result.execSummary:
The defendant Chazz Layton Hiben was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chazz Layton Hiben is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chazz Layton Hiben was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 1, 2, 3 & 5 dismissed. 

Defendant to report to probation on 8-11-15.

Court will consider expungement upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Count 4 of 14CF512 payable through probation.

-  Follow any additional programing recommended by agent.
-  Submit to DNA same and pay surcharge.
-  Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-  AODA and follow through
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew Hartung with Megan Kelly. DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF: Chazz Layton Hiben appeared. Intern  M. Kelly updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 4  in 14CF512. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 4 in 14CF512. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2, 3 and 5 with prejudice in 14CF512. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:  Sentence W/H 
3 years probation with conditions:
- 90 days St. Croix County Jail as a condition of probation STAYED.
  Court grants huber for work. 
- Costs
- AODA and follow through
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Follow any additional programing recommended by agent. 
-  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
-  Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

DE to report to probation today. 
Court will consider expungement upon successful completion of probation.
Plea hearing at 08-11-2015 01:00 pm
